dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple and SpaceX Link Up to Support Starlink Satellite Network on iPhones
News Content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. has been secretly working with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to add support for the Starlink network in its latest iPhone software, providing an alternative to the company’s in-house satellite-communication service.

Most Read from Bloomberg

Trump's Federal Funding Pause Threatens State Financials  Housing Aid Uncertain After Trump’s Spending Freeze Memo Texas HOA Charged With Discrimination for Banning Section 8 Renters Newsom Enlists Magic Johnson, Guggenheim CEO for LA Rebuilding US Students’ Reading Scores Drop to Worst in More Than 20 Years

The companies have been testing iPhones with the Starlink service from Elon Musk’s Space Exploration Technologies Corp., according to people with knowledge of the matter. In an under-the-radar move, the smartphone’s latest software update — released Monday — now supports the technology.

The tie-up comes as a surprise: T-Mobile has previously only specified Starlink as an option for Samsung Electronics Co. phones, such as the Z Fold and S24 models. Apple, meanwhile, already provides a Globalstar Inc. offering that lets consumers send texts and contact emergency responders when out of cellular range.

T-Mobile has begun allowing customers to sign up for an early version of the Starlink service, and this week the carrier enabled a small number of iPhones as part of a beta test. In a post on X responding to the news, Musk said images, music and podcasts should be supported by current Starlink technology and future upgrades will add video support as well.

The first users received text messages from T-Mobile saying, “You’re in the T-Mobile Starlink beta. You can now stay connected with texting via satellite from virtually anywhere. To start experiencing coverage beyond, please update to iOS 18.3.” Users in the program have a new toggle switch in their iPhone cellular data settings to manage the satellite feature.

An Apple spokesperson declined to comment, while T-Mobile said that the test will “begin with select optimized smartphones” and that the full launch will “support the vast majority of modern smartphones.” T-Mobile has also opened the beta to some users running Android 15, the latest version of the Google operating system. A representative for SpaceX didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

Globalstar shares fell about 11% in premarket trading in New York on Wednesday.

Ever since Apple teamed up with Globalstar to offer satellite features in 2022, there’s been speculation over whether it might support competing networks. The day after Apple’s 2022 announcement, Musk posted on X that his company has “had some promising conversations with Apple about Starlink connectivity.”

Story Continues

Here’s how it will work: When a T-Mobile iPhone is in an area without cellular connectivity, devices that are part of the Starlink program will first try to pair with SpaceX satellites. Users will also be able to activate texting via the satellite menu for the Globalstar service or contact emergency services through Apple.

The initial version of Starlink is exclusively for texting. But SpaceX and T-Mobile have said that they plan to expand into data connections and voice calls in the future. The program also is only available in the US for now. That contrasts with Apple’s Globalstar service, which works in several countries. SpaceX is looking to expand Starlink to other carriers globally.

There’s another major difference between the two services. The current Apple feature requires users to point their iPhone to the sky to find a satellite. The Starlink option, meanwhile, is designed to work automatically — even when the phone is in a customer’s pocket.

Both the Starlink and Apple satellite features are designed to work in off-the-grid areas, such as hiking trails, that don’t have cellular service. The capabilities can’t be used in places where a mobile-phone network is within reach. Support for the Apple feature is available on most current iPhone models and the company plans to bring it to its Ultra smartwatch later this year, Bloomberg News has reported.

T-Mobile updated its website this week to tell beta testers that the iPhone is supported as part of the iOS 18.3 software release. As of now, the number of users in the beta is minimal, with T-Mobile planning to expand the program in February. Apple’s announcement of iOS 18.3 touted AI features and bug fixes, but it didn’t disclose the Starlink support.

SpaceX requested authority to begin beta-testing the service starting Monday. The Federal Communications Commission granted SpaceX conditional approval for its satellites to supplement T-Mobile’s cellular network in November.

--With assistance from Loren Grush.

(Updates with Globalstar premarket shares in the seventh paragraph)

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news about Apple partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a significant development that could enhance Apple's product offerings and attract more customers, especially in areas with limited cellular coverage. This collaboration may also position Apple favorably against competitors like Globalstar, which saw a drop in its stock price following the announcement. However, the immediate impact on Apple's stock may be tempered by the fact that the beta program is currently limited and the full rollout is not yet available. Overall, the news is likely to be perceived positively, leading to a higher probability of stock price rise than fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news suggests a positive development for Apple. Partnering with SpaceX/Starlink and T-Mobile to offer satellite connectivity expands the iPhone's capabilities and potentially increases its appeal to consumers, especially in areas with poor cellular coverage. While Apple already has a Globalstar partnership, the Starlink option is presented as more seamless (automatic connection). The fact that T-Mobile is already beta-testing this with iPhones suggests a level of integration and commitment. However, the news also mentions that Globalstar shares fell, indicating a potential negative impact on Apple's existing partnership. The lack of official comment from Apple introduces some uncertainty. Overall, the potential benefits of the Starlink partnership seem to outweigh the risks, leading to a higher probability of a stock price increase. The fact that the news was 'secretly' worked on and is now being rolled out also suggests a positive surprise for investors. The negative impact on Globalstar is already priced in, and Apple's diversification is a strength.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink satellite technology into iPhones is a positive development, potentially expanding Apple's services and market reach.  However, the impact is likely to be gradual and limited in the short term. The Starlink integration is currently limited to texting in the US, and a full rollout is still some time away.  While this could be a significant long-term positive, the immediate impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be muted.  The Globalstar stock price drop suggests some investors may view this as a potential threat to existing partnerships, but Apple's overall market position and diverse product portfolio mitigate this risk.  Therefore, a small increase in stock price is more likely than a significant one, and a decrease is unlikely.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news indicates a strategic partnership between Apple, SpaceX, and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite network support into iPhones. This collaboration enhances Apple's product offering by providing an alternative to its existing Globalstar-based satellite service, potentially expanding its market appeal and technological edge. The move is likely to be viewed positively by investors as it demonstrates Apple's commitment to innovation and partnerships with leading tech companies. However, the news also mentions a drop in Globalstar shares, which could indicate some market concern about competition. Overall, the positive aspects of the partnership are likely to outweigh any negative sentiment, suggesting a higher probability of a stock price rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. (AAPL) partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones could have mixed effects on Apple's stock price. On one hand, the partnership enhances Apple's satellite communication capabilities, potentially increasing the value proposition of iPhones. On the other hand, this move might cannibalize Apple's existing satellite service provided through Globalstar Inc., which saw its shares fall about 11% in premarket trading. However, given that Apple's service is already established and the Starlink integration is more of an expansion of capabilities rather than a direct replacement, the overall impact is likely to be positive. Additionally, the automatic functionality of Starlink, even when the phone is in a pocket, could be a significant selling point. Therefore, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a positive development for the company. This partnership expands Apple's capabilities in satellite communication, providing an alternative to its in-house service and potentially increasing its market share. The fact that T-Mobile has begun allowing customers to sign up for an early version of the Starlink service and has enabled a small number of iPhones as part of a beta test suggests a strong collaboration. Additionally, the support for Starlink on iPhones could lead to increased sales and revenue for Apple. However, the impact on Globalstar, whose shares fell about 11% in premarket trading, indicates a potential loss of market share for the company. Overall, the news is likely to have a positive impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news of Apple collaborating with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink network support on iPhones could be seen as a significant strategic move, potentially enhancing iPhone functionality and competitiveness. This collaboration broadens Apple's satellite communication capabilities, providing an alternative to its existing partnership with Globalstar. While Globalstar's shares fell due to competition, the market reaction to Apple's partnerships can vary. Investors might view this as a positive development due to increased technological capabilities and potential for new revenue streams. However, the limited scope (texting only initially) and the fact that it's still in beta testing could temper immediate enthusiasm.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.68, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.32, Reasoning: The news of Apple partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a significant development that enhances Apple's product offerings and market appeal, particularly in areas with limited cellular coverage. This collaboration is likely to be viewed positively by investors, as it positions Apple favorably against competitors and expands its technological capabilities. While there are concerns regarding the impact on Apple's existing partnership with Globalstar, the overall sentiment is likely to lean towards optimism due to the innovative nature of the Starlink integration. The beta testing phase and limited initial rollout may temper immediate enthusiasm, but the long-term potential appears strong. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of stock price rise compared to fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.72, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.28, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink into iPhones is generally positive, expanding functionality and potentially attracting customers in areas with poor cellular coverage. The beta testing phase and the fact that it's initially limited to texting suggest a gradual rollout, tempering immediate enthusiasm. However, the partnership with SpaceX and T-Mobile, along with the automatic functionality of Starlink, are strong positives. The drop in Globalstar's stock price indicates a potential competitive threat, but Apple's overall market position and diverse product portfolio mitigate this risk. Considering the previous rounds' predictions, which mostly leaned towards a positive outlook, and the actual news details, I'm slightly increasing the probability of a stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.62, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.38, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink into iPhones is generally positive, expanding Apple's service offerings and potentially attracting new customers.  The automatic functionality of Starlink is a key differentiator. However, several factors temper immediate enthusiasm. The beta test is limited in scope (texting only, US only), and the full rollout is some time away.  The Globalstar stock drop highlights potential negative impacts on existing partnerships.  While the long-term potential is significant, the short-term impact is likely muted.  Considering the previous predictions, which range from 0.6 to 0.7 probability of a rise, and the mitigating factors mentioned above, a slightly more conservative estimate is warranted. The consensus leans towards a positive impact, but the uncertainty surrounding the immediate effects suggests a less dramatic shift in probability than some previous models predicted.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a significant positive development. This collaboration enhances Apple's product offerings by providing an alternative to its in-house satellite-communication service, potentially increasing the appeal of iPhones, especially in areas with limited cellular coverage. The integration of Starlink, which is designed to work automatically even when the phone is in a pocket, could be a major selling point. While the immediate impact may be limited due to the beta phase and initial support only for texting in the US, the long-term potential for expanded services like data connections and voice calls is promising. The drop in Globalstar shares indicates market recognition of this as a competitive threat to Apple's existing partnership, but Apple's diversification and innovation are likely to be viewed favorably by investors. Given the overall positive sentiment and strategic importance of this partnership, the probability of a stock price rise is higher than a fall.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is generally positive. It enhances Apple's product offerings, particularly in areas with limited cellular coverage, and positions the company favorably against competitors. While the immediate impact may be tempered by the limited scope of the beta program and the existing Globalstar partnership, the long-term prospects appear promising. The drop in Globalstar's shares indicates some market concern, but Apple's diversified portfolio and commitment to innovation are likely to mitigate negative sentiment. Overall, the partnership is expected to have a positive impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.68, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.32, Reasoning: The news about Apple partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a significant development that could enhance Apple's product offerings and attract more customers. The collaboration expands Apple's satellite communication capabilities, providing an alternative to its existing Globalstar-based service. While Globalstar's shares fell due to competition, the overall impact on Apple is likely to be positive due to increased technological capabilities and potential for new revenue streams. Considering the previous predictions from various models, which generally indicate a higher probability of the stock price rising, and taking into account the potential benefits of the Starlink partnership, the estimated probabilities are adjusted accordingly.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a strategic collaboration between Apple, SpaceX, and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite network support into iPhones. This partnership enhances Apple's satellite communication capabilities, potentially increasing the value proposition of their iPhones and positioning them more competitively against rivals. The news has positive implications for Apple's product offerings and market strategy, which is likely to appeal to investors. Although there is some concern regarding the potential impact on Apple's existing Globalstar partnership, the broader benefits of the Starlink integration seem to outweigh the negatives. The positive sentiments expressed by previous predictions and the nature of the news suggest a likelihood of stock price rise.
